ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: when the graves are emptied out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and when graves are laid open,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and the graves are turned inside out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when the graves are overturned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when the graves are laid open,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and when the graves are laid open:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when the graves are ransacked,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And when the Graves are turned upside down;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when the graves are turned upside down (and they bring out their contents)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the tombs are strewn around.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when the [contents of] graves are scattered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [82:4] and when the tombs are overturned, [when] their earth [above them] is dug up and its dead are raised (the response to idhā, ‘when’, and all that is supplemented thereto is [the following]):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the sepulchres are overturned) the dead in them are taken out,
